page.title: 04St Michaels Beetham.
page.content: Beetham Church was later dedicated to St Michael and all Angels. It was the centre of a vast ancient parish embracing Farleton, Arnside, Silverdale and Foulshaw. It was rebuilt in the 14th century and extended in Victoria Times. This confusion of styles adds to its charm. Near the entrance hall is the base of the ancient market cross and suggests it was the centre of a market place.We know definately that Thomas De Beetham obtained a charter for a market and fair in the reign of Edward Fourth in the 14th century. There is an old sun dial above the doorway of which only slight traces remain. There is some Elizabethan glass in one window.
